application.pane.resources.orderexecution

Class OrderExecution

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.pane.resources.orderexecution.OrderExecution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PaneReplacer, javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class OrderExecution
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, PaneReplacer
    This class is a Controller loaded from a .fxml file.

    Represents the Pane of performing an order execution.

    This class uses the User that has been selected in the previous Login page.

    • Field Detail

      • quantityValidityState

        private final javafx.beans.property.SimpleBooleanProperty quantityValidityState
        States if the current inputted quantity value in the quantityTextField is valid or not.

      • limitPriceValidityState

        private final javafx.beans.property.SimpleBooleanProperty limitPriceValidityState
        States if the current inputted LimitPrice value in the limitPriceTextField is valid or not.

      • activeMinQuantityValue

        private javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMinQuantityValue

        A dynamical value.

        This value indicates the minimum valid Quantity in the executed Order.

        Mainly, this number is a final value of 1.

      • activeMinLimitPriceValue

        private javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMinLimitPriceValue

        A dynamical value.

        This value indicates the minimum valid LimitPrice in the executed Order.

        Mainly, this number is a final value of 1.

      • activeMaxQuantityValue

        private javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMaxQuantityValue

        A dynamical value.

        This value indicates the maximum valid Quantity in the executed Order.

        • In case the Order is a Sell Order, then this number is set to be the maximum Quantity of the current Stock being selected in the SelectedUserContainer.getSelectedUser() .
        • In case the Order is a Buy Order, then this number is set to be the final: Long.MAX_VALUE number.

      • activeMaxLimitPriceValue

        private javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMaxLimitPriceValue

        A dynamical value.

        This value indicates the maximum valid LimitPrice in the executed Order.

        • In case the Order is a Sell Order, then this number is set to be the maximum LimitPrice of the current Stock being selected in the SelectedUserContainer.getSelectedUser() .
        • In case the Order is a Buy Order, then this number is set to be the final: Long.MAX_VALUE number.

      • initTextToLongNumbersOnly

        private void initTextToLongNumbersOnly(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField,
                                       java.lang.String field,
                                       javafx.beans.property.SimpleBooleanProperty validity,
                                       javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMinValue,
                                       javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMaxValue)
        This method enforces that the given number in the TextField would be a number.

        This method checks whether the given number within TextField is a valid long number, that is in between the values of activeMinQuantityValue and activeMaxQuantityValue.

        This method checks the given number in real-time.

        Parameters:
        textField - the TextField to enforce its field to allow numbers only.
        field - the name of the field that is presented by the TextField given. This is required in order to print a message to the user, to inform what is the validity of the current TextField's value.
        validity - updates the validity state.
        activeMinValue - the value that the TextField should be greater than or equal to this value.
        activeMaxValue - the value that the TextField should be less than or equal to this value.
        See Also:
        initTextFormatter(TextField), initTextMinMaxValueValidation(TextField, String, SimpleBooleanProperty, SimpleLongProperty, SimpleLongProperty)

      • initTextFormatter

        private void initTextFormatter(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
        This method enforces that the given number in the TextField would be a number.
        Parameters:
        textField - the TextField to:
        • enforce its field to allow numbers only.
        • enforce its field to allow only numbers in between the values of activeMinQuantityValue and activeMaxQuantityValue.

      • initTextMinMaxValueValidation

        private void initTextMinMaxValueValidation(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField,
                                           java.lang.String field,
                                           javafx.beans.property.SimpleBooleanProperty validity,
                                           javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMinValue,
                                           javafx.beans.property.SimpleLongProperty activeMaxValue)
        This method checks whether the given number within TextField is a valid long number, that is in between the values of activeMinQuantityValue and activeMaxQuantityValue.

        This method checks the given number in real-time.

        • In case the given number is valid, print an output message to the MessagePrint.Stream#OUT Stream.
        • In case the given number is invalid, print an error message to the MessagePrint.Stream#ERR Stream.
        Parameters:
        textField - the TextField to enforce its field to allow only numbers in between the values of activeMinQuantityValue and activeMaxQuantityValue.
        field - the name of the field that is presented by the TextField given. This is required in order to print a message to the user, to inform what is the validity of the current TextField's value.
        validity - updates the validity state.
        activeMinValue - the value that the TextField should be greater than or equal to this value.
        activeMaxValue - the value that the TextField should be less than or equal to this value.

      • printInvalidErrorMessage

        private void printInvalidErrorMessage(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField,
                                      java.lang.String field,
                                      java.lang.Long activeMinValue,
                                      java.lang.Long activeMaxValue)
